channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Morrison’s trolley with bags of rubbish dumped outside bike stores on Tower Mill Road, 11th October
item.description:
Nearby to the Grove Nursery School, next to the bike storage chat, somebody has dumped a trolley and people are throwing rubbish in there

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tower Mill Road, Old Kent Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dog poo in front of houses, 11th October
item.description:
Hi there are dog poo all around in front of the houses in Queens Road, the picture is taken today in front of 89 queens road, there is one near Sainsburys as well. And further along on the road towards queens road station. It has been an ongoing issue , these ones been there all week.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2D;89, Carlton Grove, Peckham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 1x stone slab missing, 11th October
item.description:

item.title: 3 Black Bags Dumped on Street Pavement, 11th October
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tower Mill Road, Old Kent Road, London

item.title: Rubbish & Flooring Planks Dumped on Pavement, 11th October
item.description:
Someone has dumped rubbish, planks and other bits & pieces on the pavement. It has been there for a week and now more people are throwing their rubbish on top of it. It’s blocking the pavement and attracting more rubbish -very grateful if you could please remove at earliest opportunity.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tower Mill Road, Old Kent Road, London

item.title: Graffiti Cherry Gdns wall, 11th October
item.description:

item.title: Abandoned and Damaged Vehicle on Thicket Road, near postbox (black Peugeot), 11th October
item.description:
I am reporting a vehicle (a black Peugeot 207) that appears to be abandoned. It has a completely flat front tyre and a detached bumper, suggesting crash damage. The car has not moved for a significant period and is occupying a vital parking space in a high-demand residential area.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Thicket Road, Crystal Palace, London
Report on FixMyStreet
